title: 2020)) after consultation with the Minister for Justice, hereby order as follows:
heading: 1. This Order may be cited as the Criminal Justice (Mutual Assistance)
text_raw:
1. This Order may be cited as the Criminal Justice (Mutual Assistance) 

Act 2008 (Designation of United Kingdom) Order 2022.
text_norm: 1 order may cited criminal justice (mutual assistance) act 2008 (designation united kingdom) order 2022

title: 2020)) after consultation with the Minister for Justice, hereby order as follows:
heading: 2. The United Kingdom of Great Britain and Northern Ireland is
text_raw:
2. The United Kingdom of Great Britain and Northern Ireland is 
designated for the purposes of mutual assistance between the State and that 
state under the Criminal Justice (Mutual Assistance) Act 2008 (No. 7 of 2008) 
in accordance with the relevant international instruments mentioned in the 
Schedule to this Order.
text_norm: 2 united kingdom great britain northern ireland designated purpose mutual assistance state state criminal justice (mutual assistance) act 2008 (no 7 2008) accordance relevant international instrument mentioned schedule order

title: 2020)) after consultation with the Minister for Justice, hereby order as follows:
heading: 3. The Criminal Justice (Mutual Assistance) Act 2008 (Designation of
text_raw:
3. The Criminal Justice (Mutual Assistance) Act 2008 (Designation of 

United Kingdom) Order 2020 (S.I. No. 718 of 2020) is hereby revoked. 

Notice of the making of this Statutory Instrument was published in 
“Iris Oifigiúil” of 4th February, 2022. 

 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 [44] 3
text_norm: 3 criminal justice (mutual assistance) act 2008 (designation united kingdom) order 2020 (s.i no 718 2020) hereby revoked notice making statutory instrument published iris oifigiuil 4th february 2022 44 3

title: 2020)) after consultation with the Minister for Justice, hereby order as follows:
heading: the European Union and
text_raw:
SCHEDULE 

the European Union and 

Titles VIII and XI of Part 3 of the Trade and Cooperation Agreement 
the European Atomic Energy 
between 
Community, of the one part, and the United Kingdom of Great Britain and 
Northern Ireland, of the other part, done at Brussels and London on 30 
December 2020 

European Convention on Mutual Assistance in Criminal Matters, done at 
Strasbourg on 20 April 1959 

Additional Protocol to the European Convention on Mutual Assistance in 
Criminal Matters, done at Strasbourg on 17 March 1978 

United Nations Convention against Illicit Traffic in Narcotic Drugs and 
Psychotropic Substances, done at Vienna on 20 December 1988 

Agreement between the Government of Ireland and the Government of the 
United Kingdom Concerning Mutual Assistance in Relation to Criminal 
Matters, done at Dublin on 26 November 1998 

Protocol to the Convention for the Protection of Cultural Property in the 
Event of Armed Conflict, done at The Hague on 26 March 1999 

Articles 13, 14, 18, 19 and 20 of the United Nations Convention against 
Transnational Organised Crime, done at New York on 15 November 2000 

Second Additional Protocol to the European Convention on Mutual 
Assistance in Criminal Matters, done at Strasbourg on 8 November 2001 

Articles 46, 49, 50 and 54 to 57 of the United Nations Convention against 
Corruption, done at New York on 31 October 2003 

GIVEN under my Official Seal, 

1 February, 2022. 

SIMON COVENEY, 

Minister for Foreign Affairs. 

 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 4 [44]

title: 2020)) after consultation with the Minister for Justice, hereby order as follows:
heading: (This note is not part of the Instrument and does not purport to be a legal
text_raw:
EXPLANATORY NOTE 

(This note is not part of the Instrument and does not purport to be a legal 
interpretation.) 

This Order designates the United Kingdom of Great Britain and Northern 
Ireland for the purposes of mutual assistance between the State and that state 
under the Criminal Justice (Mutual Assistance) Act 2008 (No. 7 of 2008), in 
accordance with the relevant international instruments set out in the Schedule 
to the Order. 

 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 [44] 5
